metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15298 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Git through 2.14.2 mishandles layers of tree objects, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a craftedrepository, aka a Git bomb. This can also have an impact of diskconsumption; however, an affected process typically would not survive itsattempt to build the data structure in memory before writing to disk.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15298` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
git-all - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
git-arch - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
git-core - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
git-cvs - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
git-daemon-run - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
git-el - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
git-email - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
git-gui - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
git-man - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
git-mediawiki - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
git-svn - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
gitk - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
gitweb - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.6').
